name: Non-text Content
supported_remarks: <Project Name> provides meaningful text alternatives for non-text content. Decorative images are ignored via null alt or CSS background, and interactive controls expose accessible names.

name: Audio-only and Video-only (Prerecorded)
supported_remarks: <Project Name> does not include prerecorded audio-only or video-only content in default functionality.

name: Captions (Prerecorded)
supported_remarks: <Project Name> does not include prerecorded multimedia; where providers embed media, captions are supported via platform capabilities.

name: Audio Description or Media Alternative (Prerecorded)
supported_remarks: <Project Name> does not include prerecorded video requiring audio description or media alternatives in default functionality.

name: Captions (Live)
supported_remarks: <Project Name> does not include live audio or video by default; caption support is available where platforms provide it.

name: Audio Description (Prerecorded)
supported_remarks: <Project Name> does not include prerecorded multimedia in default experiences; where present, audio description is supported.

name: Info and Relationships
supported_remarks: <Project Name> conveys information and relationships programmatically using semantic HTML and WAI‑ARIA landmarks, roles, and states.

name: Meaningful Sequence
supported_remarks: <Project Name> is developed in a meaningful and correct reading sequence that can be programmatically determined.

name: Sensory Characteristics
supported_remarks: <Project Name> instructions are not conveyed by shape, size, visual location, orientation, or sound alone; text alternatives are provided.

name: Orientation
supported_remarks: <Project Name> does not restrict use to a single display orientation; both portrait and landscape are supported where applicable.

name: Identify Input Purpose
supported_remarks: <Project Name> identifies common input purposes programmatically and visually labels inputs accordingly.

name: Use of Color
supported_remarks: <Project Name> does not rely on color alone to convey information, indicate actions, or distinguish elements.

name: Audio Control
supported_remarks: <Project Name> does not play audio automatically for more than 3 seconds in default experiences.

name: Contrast (Minimum)
supported_remarks: <Project Name> provides text contrast that meets or exceeds the 4.5:1 (normal) and 3:1 (large) ratios in standard themes.

name: Resize text
supported_remarks: <Project Name> content remains operable and readable when users resize text up to 200% without assistive tech.

name: Images of Text
supported_remarks: <Project Name> avoids images of text except for essential or customizable cases.

name: Reflow
supported_remarks: <Project Name> supports reflow without loss of content or functionality at 320 CSS px width (1×) equivalent where applicable.

name: Non-text Contrast
supported_remarks: <Project Name> provides sufficient contrast for non‑text UI components and graphical objects in standard themes.

name: Text Spacing
supported_remarks: <Project Name> preserves content and functionality when users adjust text spacing per the referenced metrics.

name: Content on Hover or Focus
supported_remarks: <Project Name> ensures additional content shown on hover or focus is dismissible, hoverable, and persistent as required.

name: Keyboard
supported_remarks: <Project Name> supports complete operation by keyboard alone, including standard navigation and activation.

name: No Keyboard Trap
supported_remarks: <Project Name> avoids keyboard traps; focus can move to and away from all interactive components using standard keys.

name: Character Key Shortcuts
supported_remarks: <Project Name> does not use single‑character key shortcuts that cannot be turned off, remapped, or that are limited to component focus.

name: Timing Adjustable
supported_remarks: <Project Name> provides mechanisms to extend or adjust time limits where applicable (for example, session timeouts).

name: Pause, Stop, Hide
supported_remarks: <Project Name> avoids moving, blinking, or auto‑updating content that cannot be paused, stopped, or hidden.

name: Three Flashes or Below Threshold
supported_remarks: <Project Name> avoids flashing content above thresholds that could trigger photosensitive seizures.

name: Bypass Blocks
supported_remarks: <Project Name> provides mechanisms to bypass repeated blocks of content, including landmarks and headings.

name: Page Titled
supported_remarks: <Project Name> provides descriptive, programmatically determinable page titles that indicate topic or purpose.

name: Focus Order
supported_remarks: <Project Name> provides a logical focus order that preserves meaning and operability.

name: Link Purpose (In Context)
supported_remarks: <Project Name> link purpose can be determined from link text alone or in context.

name: Multiple Ways
supported_remarks: <Project Name> provides multiple ways to locate pages, such as navigation, search, and contextual links.

name: Headings and Labels
supported_remarks: <Project Name> uses descriptive headings and labels to aid navigation and understanding.

name: Focus Visible
supported_remarks: <Project Name> provides a visible focus indicator for all interactive components.

name: Focus Not Obscured (Minimum)
supported_remarks: <Project Name> ensures the item receiving focus is not fully obscured by other content in its default position.

name: Pointer Gestures
supported_remarks: <Project Name> supports single‑pointer operation without path‑based or multipoint gestures.

name: Pointer Cancellation
supported_remarks: <Project Name> supports pointer cancellation per recommended patterns (up‑events, abort/cancel, or undo).

name: Label in Name
supported_remarks: <Project Name> ensures the accessible name of a control contains the visible label text (label‑in‑name).

name: Motion Actuation
supported_remarks: <Project Name> does not require device motion or user motion; any motion functionality has alternatives.

name: Dragging Movements
supported_remarks: <Project Name> provides alternatives to dragging movements; actions can be completed with single‑pointer activation.

name: Target Size (Minimum)
supported_remarks: <Project Name> provides target sizes and spacing that meet minimum dimensions for pointer inputs where applicable.

name: Language of Page
supported_remarks: <Project Name> specifies the default human language for pages and key documents.

name: Language of Parts
supported_remarks: <Project Name> identifies the human language of parts where content changes language.

name: On Focus
supported_remarks: <Project Name> does not initiate unexpected context changes when components receive focus.

name: On Input
supported_remarks: <Project Name> does not trigger unexpected context changes when user input is provided.

name: Consistent Navigation
supported_remarks: <Project Name> provides navigation components in a consistent relative order across pages.

name: Consistent Identification
supported_remarks: <Project Name> identifies components consistently for the same functionality across pages.

name: Consistent Help
supported_remarks: <Project Name> presents help mechanisms in a consistent location and order across comparable pages.

name: Error Identification
supported_remarks: <Project Name> identifies input errors with clear, programmatic associations to the relevant fields.

name: Labels or Instructions
supported_remarks: <Project Name> provides visible labels or instructions for user input, with programmatic associations.

name: Error Suggestion
supported_remarks: <Project Name> provides error suggestions to assist users in correcting input mistakes where feasible.

name: Error Prevention (Legal, Financial, Data)
supported_remarks: <Project Name> validates and confirms legal, financial, or data submissions with review/cancel mechanisms.

name: Redundant Entry
supported_remarks: <Project Name> avoids requiring users to re‑enter information previously provided; mechanisms to reuse data are available.

name: Accessible Authentication (Minimum)
supported_remarks: <Project Name> provides an authentication process that does not rely on cognitive function tests or includes accessible alternatives.

name: Parsing
supported_remarks: For WCAG 2.0 and 2.1, this criterion is always ‘Supports’ per the September 2023 errata; it does not apply in WCAG 2.2.

name: Name, Role, Value
supported_remarks: <Project Name> exposes name, role, state, and value via semantic HTML or WAI‑ARIA for interactive components.

name: Status Messages
supported_remarks: <Project Name> exposes status messages programmatically so assistive technologies can announce them without moving focus.

name: Sign Language (Prerecorded)
supported_remarks: <Project Name> supports sign language alternatives where applicable content is provided.

name: Extended Audio Description (Prerecorded)
supported_remarks: <Project Name> supports extended audio description where applicable content is provided.

name: Media Alternative (Prerecorded)
supported_remarks: <Project Name> supports full media alternatives for prerecorded multimedia where applicable.

name: Audio-only (Live)
supported_remarks: <Project Name> supports live audio‑only alternatives where applicable.

name: Contrast (Enhanced)
supported_remarks: <Project Name> can support enhanced contrast for text where theming allows.

name: Low or No Background Audio
supported_remarks: <Project Name> avoids audio backgrounds or provides mechanisms to reduce background audio to meet the criterion.

name: Visual Presentation
supported_remarks: <Project Name> supports user control of text presentation where applicable to meet visual presentation requirements.

name: Images of Text (No Exception)
supported_remarks: <Project Name> avoids images of text without exception, except for essential cases.

name: Keyboard (No Exception)
supported_remarks: <Project Name> supports complete operation via keyboard without exceptions.

name: No Timing
supported_remarks: <Project Name> does not impose timing that cannot be turned off where applicable.

name: Interruptions
supported_remarks: <Project Name> allows users to postpone or suppress interruptions where applicable.

name: Re-authenticating
supported_remarks: <Project Name> allows users to re‑authenticate without loss of data where applicable.

name: Timeouts
supported_remarks: <Project Name> informs users of timeouts that could result in loss of data, where applicable.

name: Three Flashes
supported_remarks: <Project Name> does not include flashing content above thresholds (three flashes).

name: Animation from Interactions
supported_remarks: <Project Name> provides a mechanism to disable animation triggered by interactions where applicable.

name: Location
supported_remarks: <Project Name> provides the user’s location within a set of pages where applicable.

name: Link Purpose (Link Only)
supported_remarks: <Project Name> uses link text alone to identify purpose where feasible.

name: Section Headings
supported_remarks: <Project Name> provides section headings to organize content where appropriate.

name: Focus Not Obscured (Enhanced)
supported_remarks: <Project Name> ensures the focused item is at least minimally unobscured (enhanced) as applicable.

name: Focus Appearance
supported_remarks: <Project Name> provides a highly visible focus appearance meeting minimum area and contrast thresholds where applicable.

name: Target Size
supported_remarks: <Project Name> provides large pointer targets where possible, or spacing to meet the target size requirement.

name: Concurrent Input Mechanisms
supported_remarks: <Project Name> allows concurrent input mechanisms without disabling others.

name: Unusual Words
supported_remarks: <Project Name> explains unusual words and idioms where they appear in user‑facing content.

name: Abbreviations
supported_remarks: <Project Name> provides expansions for abbreviations where used in user‑facing content.

name: Reading Level
supported_remarks: <Project Name> aims for lower secondary reading level for blocks of text or provides alternative support.

name: Pronunciation
supported_remarks: <Project Name> provides pronunciation for words where needed to avoid ambiguity.

name: Change on Request
supported_remarks: <Project Name> changes occur only on user request in applicable interactions.

name: Help
supported_remarks: <Project Name> provides help mechanisms, such as context help or contact support, for complex tasks where applicable.

name: Error Prevention (All)
supported_remarks: <Project Name> prevents errors for all submissions by providing review, confirmation, and reversal where feasible.

name: Accessible Authentication (Enhanced)
supported_remarks: <Project Name> provides authentication that avoids cognitive function tests or offers object/biometric alternatives where applicable.
